channel.title: Mod Logos - Steam Interface Info
channel.description:
Before this got purged off the steam forums, I wanted to throw it someplace else. I know I wasn't the only person that was bugged by this, but in short I figured out a way to rename and re-logo the mods that show up in your steam list.
----------------------------- [b]Add a Steam interface logo to your Half Life mods[/b] Create a logo.tga picture that is 16 x 16 and put it in the main directory for mod. Example: C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\acct\half-life\asheep In the same directory, find and open liblist.gam file with notepad and add this line icon "logo"
[b]Edit your Steam interface game names[/b] Half Life Mods: Go to the main directory for mod. Example: C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\acct\half-life\asheep Open liblist.gam file with notepad and edit the line game "Azure Sheep" to reflect how you want the name to show in the steam interface.
Half Life 2 Mods: Go to main directory for mod. Example: C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\SourceMods\CausalityEffect Open gameinfo.txt file with notepad and edit the line game "Causality Effect" to reflect how you want the name to show in the steam interface.

Cameron :smiley: :

I don’t think gameinfo. its the _english (or whatever language) that contains those strings), I think that stuff is based off the folder name that the mod is in (Unless is is a stripped-down version of the mod name set in gameinfo, in which case you are correct)

You’re right, the first thing I did to mess it up was rename a mod folder by accident.

The solution was to edit the _english file as well…
